repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
* define vim.{pack,spell} to make emmylua_ls found them
(https://github.com/EmmyLuaLs/emmylua-analyzer-rust/issues/697)
* stdpath overload seems supported by both lua_ls/emmylua_ls now

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body:
It seems `gen_eval_files.lua` don't support overload

so before it's ok in docs but bad in types, now it's ok in types but bad in docs.
[`ea68f69`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/37101/commits/ea68f69b5ab1518d6b71cf4b4653dfd466c159c2) use `@overload`... I follow the style of `vim.system`.

I tried to fix that myself a while back but had to give up; as you write, it seems impossible without a lot of work to `gen_eval_files` to have both the meta and the docs correct.

In the end, I just bit the bullet and used, e.g.,
```lua
vim.fs.joinpath(vim.fn.stdpath('data') --[[@as string]], 'site')
```
The use of overloads in general is an issue with `emmylua_ls`; this also affects `vim.diagnostic.config()`, for example.

comment_regular_data.body: I believe your title, description, and one of your commit names are slightly wrong. This is for `vim.mpack`, not `vim.pack`, right?
I think the overloads we had for `stdpath` was ok. Before changing here, we should probably check if Emmy lua can support the style we have now.
No, emmylua currently warns on the code snippet I posted earlier (without the annotation). (Doesn't mean one couldn't open a feature request.)
I don't understand. I'm suggesting this is probably a bug in Emmy lua. I don't think the annotations we have right now are incorrect, especially in meta files.
Sorry, then I misunderstood (and agree with you).

> Before changing here, we should probably check if Emmy lua can support the style we have now.

What's the conclusion here? @phanen
no confirm as a bug from upstram yet: https://github.com/EmmyLuaLs/emmylua-analyzer-rust/issues/651

We're not even using Emmy lua in ci yet so I strongly prefer we hold off (or close) this until we've decided something conclusive on the Emmy lua side.

In the meantime I'd focus on fixing other Emmy lua lint issues.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(types): vim.{mpack,spell}, stdpath() overload
